summary: This is an email chain from May 26, 2020, discussing investigative steps regarding Mark Epstein, including subpoenas for phone and email records. It also references a post-suicide BOP report describing that Tartaglione 'saved' Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: The email chain discusses investigative steps regarding Mark Epstein, including subpoenas for his phone numbers and email addresses originating from fastmail.com.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Mentioned in reference to a post-suicide BOP report that describes him as having 'saved' Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced indirectly in the context of his suicide and a report stating Tartaglione 'saved' him.

connections.description: A post-suicide BOP report describes Tartaglione as having 'saved' Epstein, indicating some interaction during incarceration.

events.title: Email discussion on Mark Epstein investigation
events.description: Prosecutors and investigators discuss steps to subpoena phone and email records for Mark Epstein, including emergency disclosure requests to fastmail.com and legal@signalwire.com.

keyFacts: The email references a post-suicide BOP report that describes inmate Tartaglione as having 'saved' Jeffrey Epstein.
Investigators are actively working on subpoenas and emergency disclosure requests for Mark Epstein's phone numbers and email records.
Mark Epstein's email address and phone number were found via a simple Google search during the investigation.
The email correspondence involves prosecutors (AUSAs) and investigators coordinating on the Mark Epstein matter.
